segments.text: It's Sunday morning on CBS, and here again is Jane Pauley. For

the past 6 decades, whether he's directing, writing, or acting, the award winning filmmaker Werner Herzog has been a most singular voice in the movies. This morning he's using that voice in conversation with our Ben Mankiewicz.
Uh, Werner, did you, uh, turn your cell phone
Saxon the City is one of those pop cultural touchstones that resonates to this day. The woman behind it, author Candace Bushnell. She's talking with our Michelle Miller.
So do you still love New York City? I do. I really do.
every day. New York City has inspired writer Candace Bushnell for decades.
